channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bins overflowing & not being collected or used, 12th December
item.description:
Regular occurrence with these bins overflowing and then additional rubbish just being dumped in front or around them. This attract rodents and the smell is horrendous. Biggest culprit I believe is Voodoo Rays and always full of pizza and pizza boxes.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 7inch pothole, 12th December
item.description:
While driving on Crown Dale, my vehicle sustained damage when it struck a pothole that was not visible or properly marked. The impact caused my tires to burst, leaving the car unsafe to operate and resulting in unexpected repair expenses. This pothole poses a hazard not only to my vehicle but to other motorists as well. I am requesting that the issue be reviewed and that appropriate action be taken to repair the roadway and address the damages incurred as a result of this incident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Dale, Upper Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial Waste Dumped by Three Hounds, 12th December
item.description:
Commercial waste still being left outside outside of the collection window by the Three Hounds Pub. These photos were taken during the business operating hours, outside the from on the public highway and this is the 17th reported incident of flytipping by this business, a repeat offender. Times of photos are 19:28 & 20:42 and it is still there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass being destroyed, 12th December
item.description:
The park grass here has been chewed up by either park security or the park maintenance. This is making the foot path muddy and dangerous and has destroyed yet another area of the public park grass land. What needs to be done to protect the Priory Garden's park from this continued damage by the the service Bromley Council are paying to look after it ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Goddington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parked on the parent and child spot without being with a child/baby, 12th December
item.description:
We came to the store this evening, we have a baby of 7months, parking spots are hard to find, and mostly of them are used by the people without, in front of us it was a car with a couple who pParked on the parent and child parking spot without being with a child/baby. I asked them if they have a child, so we can change spots since we had our 7 months old in the car.. they walk off and then started to shout and swearing.. Please check the cameras and do something.. as there are so many parents left without a spot.. and is a real struggle... Regards, Bogdan Andrei

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cygnet View, West Thurrock, South Ockendon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of about five big garbage bags and someone’s adding to them outside Mansfield Court on the pavement, 12th December
item.description:
This week somebody has been fly tipping big bags of rubbish. They have started with about two but now about six there. It’s on the pavement opposite Mansfield Court and this will create a hazard because of foxes and rats who may break up in the bags.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
